member.name: F:Couchbase.Analytics.AnalyticsScanConsistency.NotBounded
member.summary: The default which means that the query can return data that is currently indexed and accessible by the index or the view. The query output can be arbitrarily out-of-date if there are many pending mutations that have not been indexed by the index or the view. This consistency level is useful for queries that favor low latency and do not need precise and most up-to-date information.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Analytics.AnalyticsScanConsistency.RequestPlus
member.summary: This level provides the strictest consistency level and thus executes with higher latencies than the other levels. This consistency level requires all mutations, up to the moment of the query request, to be processed before the query execution can start.

member.name: T:Couchbase.NotifyPropertyChangedInvocatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the method is contained in a type that implements interface and this method is used to notify that some property value changed
member.remarks:
The method should be non-static and conform to one of the supported signatures:
NotifyChanged(string)
NotifyChanged(params string[])
NotifyChanged{T}(Expression{Func{T}})
NotifyChanged{T,U}(Expression{Func{T,U}})
SetProperty{T}(ref T, T, string)

member.name: T:Couchbase.ContractAnnotationAttribute
member.summary: Describes dependency between method input and output
member.syntax:
Function Definition Table syntax:
FDT ::= FDTRow [;FDTRow]*
FDTRow ::= Input => Output | Output <= Input
Input ::= ParameterName: Value [, Input]*
Output ::= [ParameterName: Value]* {halt|stop|void|nothing|Value}
Value ::= true | false | null | notnull | canbenull
If method has single input parameter, it's name could be omitted.
Using halt (or void/nothing, which is the same) for method output means that the methos doesn't return normally.
canbenull annotation is only applicable for output parameters.
You can use multiple [ContractAnnotation] for each FDT row, or use single attribute with rows separated by semicolon.

item.code: [ContractAnnotation("halt <= condition: false")] public void Assert(bool condition, string text) // regular assertion method
[ContractAnnotation("s:null => true")] public bool IsNullOrEmpty(string s) // string.IsNullOrEmpty()
[ContractAnnotation("s:null=>false; =>true,result:notnull; =>false, result:null")] public bool TryParse(string s, out Person result)

member.name: M:Couchbase.ClusterExtensions.QueryInterpolatedAsync``1(Couchbase.ICluster,Couchbase.Query.QueryInterpolatedStringHandler@)
member.summary: Executes an interpolated query.
member.typeparam: Type of row returned by the query.
member.param: Cluster against which to execute the query.

remarks.para: Treats expressions in the interpolated string as positional parameters. This makes prepared queries with dynamic parameters very easy to build. Note that format strings and alignment are ignored. Also, you may only use expressions in locations in the query where parameters are acceptable.
This overload executes the query with AdHoc false, resulting in prepared queries.

remarks.para: Treats expressions in the interpolated string as positional parameters. This makes prepared queries with dynamic parameters very easy to build. member.summary: Executes an interpolated query.

remarks.para: Treats expressions in the interpolated string as positional parameters. This makes prepared queries with dynamic parameters very easy to build. This overload does not default AdHoc to false like the other overloads. If you desire prepared queries, be sure to set AdHoc to false in .

member.name: P:Couchbase.ClusterOptions.Compression
member.summary: Enables compression for key/value operations.
member.remarks: The value is ignored if no compression algorithm is supplied via . Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Couchbase.ClusterOptions.CompressionMinSize
member.summary: If compression is enabled, the minimum document size considered for compression (in bytes). Documents smaller than this size are always sent to the server uncompressed.
member.remarks: The default is 32.

member.name: P:Couchbase.ClusterOptions.CompressionMinRatio
member.summary: If compression is enabled, the minimum compression ratio to accept when sending documents to the server. Documents which don't achieve this compression ratio are sent to the server uncompressed.
member.remarks: 1.0 means no compression was achieved. A value of 0.75 would result in documents which compress to at least 75% of their original size to be transmitted compressed. The default is 0.83 (83%).

To ignore RemoteCertificateNameMismatch and RemoteCertificateChainErrors errors caused when the subject and subject alternative name do not match the requesting DNS name, set ClusterOptions.HttpIgnoreRemoteCertificateMismatch to true.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Core.Compatibility.InterfaceStabilityAttribute
member.summary: Annotation for the interface stability of a given API. A stable interface is one that is guaranteed not to change between versions, meaning that you may use an API of a given SDK version and be assured that the given API will retain the same parameters and behavior in subsequent versions. An unstable interface is one which may appear to work or behave in a specific way within a given SDK version, but may change in its behavior or arguments in future SDK versions, causing odd application behavior or compiler/API usage errors.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Core.Compatibility.InterfaceStabilityAttribute.Level
member.summary: The interface stability of the API.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Core.Compatibility.Level
member.summary: Designates the interface stability of a given API; how likely the interface is to change or be removed entirely.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.Compatibility.Level.Committed
member.summary: This stability level is used to indicate the most stable interfaces that are guaranteed to be supported and remain stable between SDK versions.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.Compatibility.Level.Uncommitted
member.summary: This level is used to indicate APIs that are unlikely to change, but may still change as final consensus on their behavior has not yet been reached. Uncommitted APIs usually end up becoming stable APIs.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.Compatibility.Level.Volatile
member.summary: This level is used to indicate experimental APIs that are still in flux and may likely be changed. It may also be used to indicate inherently private APIs that may be exposed, but "YMMV" (your mileage may vary) principles apply. Volatile APIs typically end up being promoted to Uncommitted after undergoing some modifications.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Core.Configuration.Server.BucketConfig.SetEffectiveNetworkResolution(Couchbase.ClusterOptions)
member.summary: Sets the "effective" network resolution to be used for alternate addresses using the following heuristic: "internal": The SDK should be using the normal addresses/ports as specified in the config. "external": The SDK should be using the "external" alternate-address address/ports as specified in the config. "auto" (default): The SDK should be making a determination based on the heuristic that is in the RFC at bootstrap time only, and then once this determination has been made, the network resolution mode should be unambiguously set to "internal" or "external".

member.name: T:Couchbase.Core.DI.SingletonGenericServiceFactory
member.summary: Implementation of which constructs more specific types from a non-specific generic with the same number of type arguments. Keeps a singleton of each type to return on subsequent calls.

remarks.para: For example, new SingletonGenericServiceFactory(typeof(Logger<>)) could be registered against ILogger<>. A request for ILogger<SomeType> would return a singleton of the more specific implementation Logger<SomeType>.
This factory must be registered against a generic type with the same number of type arguments and the same or stricter type argument constraints.

Retrying the operation when the item's value or status has changed may succeed.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.Errors.ErrorAttribute.ConnStateInvalid
member.summary: The current connection is no longer valid. The client must reconnect to the server. Note that the presence of other attributes may indicate an alternate remedy to fixing the connection without a disconnect, but without special remedial action a disconnect is needed.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.Errors.ErrorAttribute.Auth
member.summary: The operation failed because the client failed to authenticate or is not authorized to perform this operation. Note that this error in itself does not mean the connection is invalid, unless conn-state-invalidated is also present.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.Errors.ErrorAttribute.SpecialHandling
member.summary: This error code must be handled specially. If it is not handled, the connection must be dropped.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.Errors.ErrorAttribute.Support

member.name: P:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.IOperation.Completed
member.summary: Task which indicates completion of the operation. Once this task is complete, the result has been received and, if successful, read.
member.remarks:
It is important that rules about ValueTask be followed here. The task should only be awaited once, never more than once. Calling will reset the task, after which it may be awaited again.
For more information, see https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/understanding-the-whys-whats-and-whens-of-valuetask/#valid-consumption-patterns-for-valuetasks

member.summary: During SASL authentication, another step (or more) must be made before authentication is complete. This is a system-level response status.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.InvalidRange
member.summary: The value was outside of supported range.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.Rollback
member.summary: Roll back to an earlier version of the vbucket UUID (_currently_ only used by DCP for agreeing on selecting a starting point)

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.Eaccess
member.summary: No access (could be opcode, value, bucket etc)

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.NotInitialized
member.summary: The Couchbase cluster is currently initializing this node, and the Cluster manager has not yet granted all users access to the cluster.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.UnknownCommand
member.summary: The server received an unknown command from a client.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.OutOfMemory
member.summary: The server is temporarily out of memory.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.NotSupported
member.summary: The operation is not supported.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.InternalError
member.summary: An internal error has occured.
member.remarks: See logs for more details.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.Busy
member.summary: The server was too busy to complete the operation.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.TemporaryFailure
member.summary: A temporary error has occured in the server.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.ClientFailure
member.summary: A client error has occured before the operation could be sent to the server.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.OperationTimeout
member.summary: The operation exceeded the specified OperationTimeout configured for the client instance.
member.remarks: The default is 2500ms.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.NoReplicasFound
member.summary: Returned when the client cannot locate a replica within the cluster map config for a replica read. This would happen if a bucket was not configured to have replicas; if you encounter this error check to make sure you have indeed configured replicas on your bucket.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.NodeUnavailable
member.summary: The node or service that the key has been mapped to is offline or cannot be reached.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.TransportFailure
member.summary: Indicates that a transport layer failure occured while the client was sending or receiving data.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.DocumentMutationLost
member.summary: Document Mutation lost during a hard failover.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.DocumentMutationDetected
member.summary: A document mutation was detected on the document being observed.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocPathNotFound
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating the path inside the JSON is invalid.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocPathMismatch
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating one of the path components was denoting a wrong type (eg. trying to access an array index in an entry that isn't an array). Also for arithmetic operations when the value of the path is not a number.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocPathInvalid
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that the path provided is invalid. For operations requiring an array index, this is returned if the last component of that path isn't an array. Similarly for operations requiring a dictionary, if the last component isn't a dictionary but eg. an array index.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocPathTooBig
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that the path is too large (ie. the string is too long) or too deep (more that 32 components).

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocDocTooDeep
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that the target document's level of JSON nesting is too deep to be processed by the subdoc service.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocCannotInsert
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that the target document is not flagged or recognized as JSON.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocDocNotJson
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that, for arithmetic subdoc operations, the existing number is already too large.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocNumRange
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that for arithmetic subdoc operations, the operation will make the value too large.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocDeltaRange
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that for arithmetic subdoc operations, the operation will make the value too large.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocPathExists
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that the last component of the path already exist despite the mutation operation expecting it not to exist (the mutation was expecting to create only the last part of the path and store the fragment there).

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocValueTooDeep
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that, in a multi-specification, an invalid combination of commands were specified, including the case where too many paths were specified.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocInvalidCombo
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that, in a multi-specification, an invalid combination of commands were specified, including the case where too many paths were specified.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocMultiPathFailure
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating that, in a multi-specification, one or more commands failed to execute on a document which exists (ie. the key was valid).

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocSuccessDeletedDocument
member.summary: SubDocument status indicating that the subdoc operation completed successfully on the deleted document.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocXattrInvalidFlagCombo
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating the flag combination for an XATTR operation was invalid.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubDocXattrInvalidKeyCombo
member.summary: Subdocument error indicating the key combination for an XATTR opeation was invalid.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubdocXattrUnknownMacro
member.summary: The server has no knowledge of the requested macro

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubdocXattrUnknownVattr
member.summary: The server has no knowledge of the requested virtual xattr

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubdocXattrCantModifyVattr
member.summary: Virtual xattrs can't be modified

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubdocMultiPathFailureDeleted
member.summary: [For multi-path commands only] Specified key was found as a Deleted document, but one or more path operations failed. Examine the individual lookup_result (MULTI_LOOKUP) mutation_result (MULTI_MUTATION) structures for details.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SubdocInvalidXattrOrder
member.summary: According to the spec all xattr commands should come first, followed by the commands for the document body

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.UnknownCollection
member.summary: Collection does not exist/Collection Outdated

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.UnknownScope
member.summary: The Scope does not exist/Collection Outdated

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.DurabilityInvalidLevel
member.summary: Invalid request. Returned if an invalid durability level is specified.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.DurabilityImpossible
member.summary: Valid request, but given durability requirements are impossible to achieve - because insufficient configured replicas are connected. Assuming level=majority and C=number of configured nodes, durability becomes impossible if floor((C + 1) / 2) nodes or greater are offline.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SyncWriteInProgress
member.summary: Returned if an attempt is made to mutate a key which already has a SyncWrite pending. Transient, the client would typically retry (possibly with backoff). Similar to ELOCKED.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SyncWriteAmbiguous
member.summary: The SyncWrite request has not completed in the specified time and has ambiguous result - it may Succeed or Fail; but the final value is not yet known.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.SyncWriteReCommitInProgress
member.summary: A SyncWrite request re-commit is in progress.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.NoCollectionsManifest
member.summary: No collections manifest has been set. The server does not support scopes or collections.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.RateLimitedNetworkIngress
member.summary: Rate limited: Network Ingress

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.RateLimitedNetworkEgress
member.summary: Rate limited: Network Egress

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.RateLimitedMaxConnections
member.summary: Rate limited: Max Connections

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.RateLimitedMaxCommands
member.summary: Rate limited: Max Commands

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.ScopeSizeLimitExceeded
member.summary: Quota limited: Max number of scopes has been exceeded

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.RangeScanMore
member.summary: Scan has reached a limit and has not reached the end key, more data maybe available and the client must issue another continue.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ResponseStatus.RangeScanComplete
member.summary: Scan has reached the end of the range.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures
member.summary: Features that they client negotiate on a per connection basis.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.Datatype
member.summary: For custom data types

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.TcpNoDelay
member.summary: Enable TCP nodelay

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.MutationSeqno
member.summary: Return the sequence number with every mutation

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.TcpDelay
member.summary: Disable TCP nodelay

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.SubdocXAttributes
member.summary: Perform subdocument operations on document attributes

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.XError
member.summary: Return extended error information for the client to use in K/V Error Mapping. Implies the client will request that information from the server to use in mapping error attributes and classes.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.SelectBucket
member.summary: Indicates if the cluster supports RBAC and if a Select_Bucket operation should be executed when opening a bucket.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.SnappyCompression
member.summary: Requests that the connection use Snappy compression on request, and indicates if the server supports Snappy compression on response.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.ServerDuration
member.summary: Retrieve the Server Duration of the operation. This enables the server to return responds with magic .

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.AlternateRequestSupport
member.summary: Indicates if the client can send requests that include Framing Extras encoded into the request packet.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.SynchronousReplication
member.summary: Indicates if requests can include synchronous replication requirements into framing extras. NOTE: Requires be enabled too.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.Collections
member.summary: Indicates if the server supports scoped collections.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.UnorderedExecution
member.summary: Support unordered execution of operations.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.CreateAsDeleted
member.summary: Enables the "create as deleted" flag, allowing a document to be created in a tombstoned state.
member.remarks: Requires Couchbase Server 6.6 or greater.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.PreserveTtl
member.summary: Enables preserving expiry when updating document.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Core.IO.Operations.ServerFeatures.JSON
member.summary: Enables JSON as a data type for KV range scans.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Core.IO.Serializers.IJsonStreamReader.ReadToNextAttributeAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Reads until the next attribute is found in the stream. Returns the path to the attribute, or null if the end of the stream is reached.
member.returns: Path to the attribute relative to the overall stream, or null if the end of the stream is reached"
member.remarks: The returned path is "." separated, and relative to the overall stream. For example, if the attribute "metrics" is on the root object, returns "metrics". If the attribute reached is "count" on the "metrics" object, the returned value is "metrics.count". Arrays are indicated with square brackets, for example "results[0].abv".

member.name: T:Couchbase.Core.IO.Serializers.SystemTextJson.TypeSerializerWrapper
member.summary: Wraps an object which should be serialized to JSON using an . This allows System.Text.Json serialization to override the behavior of a particular object and serialize it with the configured . In this way, some parts of the JSON object graph are serialized by our internal serializer and others by the custom serializer.
member.remarks: Note that some simple intrinsics, such as strings and numbers, may be serialized with the default serializer for performance reasons.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Core.Logging.Redacted`1
member.summary: Wraps a value in an optional pair of redaction tags when written to a string. String formatting is delayed the call to ToString. This avoids the string formatting cost for disabled log levels.

remarks.para: Since this type is a structure, it avoids heap allocations so long as we're using strongly typed logging mechanisms to avoid boxing. Making it generic also allows .NET 6 and C# 10 to use more efficient string building paradigms such as ISpanFormattable.

Because this type implements ISpanFormattable in .NET 6 it also avoids string allocations when used in string interpolation expressions so long as also implements ISpanFormattable. There are some cases where generated C# logging methods use string interpolation to build the log message.

member.summary: No redaction is performed; this is the default.

member.name: T:Couchbase.KeyValue.DurabilityLevel
member.summary: The required number of nodes which the mutation must be replicated to (and/or persisted to) for durability requirements to be met. Possible values:

member.name: F:Couchbase.KeyValue.DurabilityLevel.None
member.summary: No durability requirements.

member.name: F:Couchbase.KeyValue.DurabilityLevel.Majority
member.summary: Mutation must be replicated to (i.e. held in memory of that node) a majority of the configured nodes of the bucket.

member.name: F:Couchbase.KeyValue.DurabilityLevel.MajorityAndPersistToActive
member.summary: Same as majority, but additionally persisted to the active node.

member.name: F:Couchbase.KeyValue.DurabilityLevel.PersistToMajority
member.summary: Mutation must be persisted to (i.e. written and fsync'd to disk) a majority of the configured nodes of the bucket.

member.name: T:Couchbase.KeyValue.ExpressionVisitors.LambdaSimplifyingExpressionVisitor
member.summary: Simplifies an expression tree by evaluating any branches of the tree that do not include lambda parameter references. This will remove references to variables external to the lambda by converting them to constants, perform arithmetic, and execute method calls as needed. For example, a call to "str.ToUpper()" where string is an external variable would be simplified to a containing the uppercase version of str.

member.name: M:Couchbase.KeyValue.ExpressionVisitors.LambdaSimplifyingExpressionVisitor.Simplify(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression)
member.summary: Simplifies an expression tree by evaluating any branches of the tree that do not include lambda parameter references. This will remove references to variables external to the lambda by converting them to constants, perform arithmetic, and execute method calls as needed. For example, a call to "str.ToUpper()" where string is an external variable would be simplified to a containing the uppercase version of str.

member.name: M:Couchbase.KeyValue.ExpressionVisitors.LambdaSimplifyingExpressionVisitor.#ctor

member.name: M:Couchbase.KeyValue.ExpressionVisitors.LambdaSimplifyingExpressionVisitor.VisitChildren(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression@,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression@)
member.summary: Visits a list of children to see if they are evaluatable or not. If a branch of the tree can be evaluated but another cannot, simplifies the branches that can be evaluated to constants. Modifies the provided collection with the new expressions.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Management.Buckets.EvictionPolicyType.ValueOnly
member.summary: During ejection, only the value will be ejected (key and metadata will remain in memory). Value Ejection needs more system memory, but provides better performance than Full Ejection. This value is only valid for buckets of type

member.summary: When the memory quota is reached, Couchbase Server ejects data that has not been used recently. This value is only valid for buckets of type

member.name: F:Couchbase.Management.Buckets.EvictionPolicyType.NoEviction
member.summary: Couchbase Server keeps all data until explicitly deleted, but will reject any new data if you reach the quota(dedicated memory) you set for your bucket. This value is only valid for buckets of type

member.summary: Number of threads each worker utilizes.
member.remarks: Minimum is 1.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.DcpStreamBoundary
member.summary: Indicates where to start dcp stream from (beginning of time, present point) 'from_prior' is deprecated in 6.6.2.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.Description
member.summary: Free form text for user to describe the handler. no functional role.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.DeploymentStatus
member.summary: Indicates if the function is deployed. true=deployed, false=undeployed.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.ProcessingStatus
member.summary: Indicates if the function is running (i.e., not paused). true=running, false=paused.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.LanguageCompatibility
member.summary: Eventing language version this handler assumes in terms of syntax and behavior.
member.remarks: Default is '6.6.2'.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.LogLevel
member.summary: Level of detail in system logging.
member.remarks: Default is INFO.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.ExecutionTimeout
member.summary: Maximum time the handler can run before it is forcefully terminated (in seconds).
member.remarks: The minimum is 1 and the default is 60s.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.LcbInstCapacity
member.summary: Maximum number of libcouchbase connections that may be opened and pooled.
member.remarks: The minimum is 1 and the default is 10.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.LcbRetryCount
member.summary: Number of retries of retriable libcouchbase failures. 0 keeps trying till execution_timeout.
member.remarks: The default is 0.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.LcbTimeout
member.summary: Maximum time the lcb command is waited until completion before we terminate the request(in seconds).
member.remarks: The minimum is 1 and the default is 5.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.QueryConsistency
member.summary: Consistency level used by n1ql statements in the handler.
member.remarks: The default is 'none' or 'not bounded'.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.NumTimerPartitions
member.summary: Number of timer shards. defaults to number of vbuckets.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.SockBatchSize
member.summary: Batch size for messages from producer to consumer. normally, this must not be specified.
member.remarks: Default is 1.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.TickDuration
member.summary: Duration to log stats from this handler, in milliseconds.
member.remarks: The default is 60000ms.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.TimerContextSize
member.summary: Size limit of timer context object
member.remarks: The minimum is 20, the max is 20971520 and the default is 1024.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.UserPrefix
member.summary: Key prefix for all data stored in metadata by this handler.
member.remarks: The default is 'eventing'.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.BucketCacheSize
member.summary: Maximum size in bytes the bucket cache can grow to.
member.remarks: The minimum is 20971520 and the default is 67108864.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.BucketCacheAge
member.summary: Time in milliseconds after which a cached bucket object is considered stale.
member.remarks: The minimum is 1 and the default is 1000.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.CurlMaxAllowedRespSize
member.summary: Maximum allowable curl call response in 'MegaBytes'. Setting the value to 0 lifts the upper limit off. This parameters affects v8 engine stability since it defines the maximum amount of heap space acquired by a curl call
member.remarks: The default is 100mb.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.QueryPrepareAll
member.summary: Automatically prepare all n1ql statements in the handler.
member.remarks: The default is false.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.WorkerCount
member.summary: Number of worker processes handler utilizes on each eventing node.
member.remarks: The minimum is 1 and the default is 1.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.HandlerHeaders
member.summary: Code to automatically prepend to top of handler code.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.HandlerFooters
member.summary: Code to automatically append to bottom of handler code.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.EnableAppLogRotation
member.summary: Enable rotating this handlers log() message files.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.AppLogDir
member.summary: Directory to write content of log() message files.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.AppLogMaxSize
member.summary: Rotate logs when file grows to this size in bytes approximately.
member.remarks: The minimum is 1024b and the max is 41943040b.

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.AppLogMaxFiles

member.name: P:Couchbase.Management.Eventing.EventingFunctionSettings.CheckpointInterval

member.name: T:Couchbase.Management.ManagementSerializerContext
member.summary: Internal used for management operations.
member.remarks: This is separate from the context used for general internal operations as an optimization. There is some small cost to the static constructor of a JsonSerializerContext, which scales based on the number of types included. Since management operations are more rarely used than others we keep them on a separate context.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Query.IQueryCacheInvalidator.InvalidateQueryCache
member.summary: Invalidates and clears the query cache. This method can be used to explicitly clear the internal N1QL query cache. This cache will be filled with non-adhoc query statements (query plans) to speed up those subsequent executions. Triggering this method will wipe out the complete cache, which will not cause an interruption but rather all queries need to be re-prepared internally. This method is likely to be deprecated in the future once the server side query engine distributes its state throughout the cluster.
member.returns: An representing the size of the cache before it was cleared.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Query.QueryOptions.MaxServerParallelism(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies the maximum parallelism for the query. A zero or negative value means the number of logical cpus will be used as the parallelism for the query. There is also a server wide max_parallelism parameter which defaults to 1. If a request includes max_parallelism, it will be capped by the server max_parallelism. If a request does not include max_parallelism, the server wide max_parallelism will be used.

member.remarks: The default is true; the query will executed in an ad-hoc manner, without special optimizations.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Query.QueryScanConsistency
member.summary: Sets the desired index scan consistency for current N1QL query.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Query.QueryScanConsistency.NotBounded
member.summary: The default which means that the query can return data that is currently indexed and accessible by the index or the view. The query output can be arbitrarily out-of-date if there are many pending mutations that have not been indexed by the index or the view. This consistency level is useful for queries that favor low latency and do not need precise and most up-to-date information.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Query.QueryScanConsistency.RequestPlus
member.summary: This level provides the strictest consistency level and thus executes with higher latencies than the other levels. This consistency level requires all mutations, up to the moment of the query request, to be processed before the query execution can start.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Search.Queries.Simple.MatchPhraseQuery
member.summary: A match query searches for terms occurring in the specified positions and offsets. The input text is analyzed and a phrase query is built with the terms resulting from the analysis. This depends on term vectors, which are consulted to determine phrase distance.

member.summary: Specifies how the individual match terms should be logically concatenated.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Search.Queries.Simple.PhraseQuery
member.summary: The phrase query allows to query for exact term phrases in the index. The provided terms must exist in the correct order, at the correct index offsets, in the specified field (as no analyzer are applied to the terms). Queried field must have been indexed with includeTermVectors set to true. It is generally more useful in debugging scenarios, and the Match Phrase Query should usually be preferred for real-world use cases.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Search.SearchScanConsistency
member.summary: Sets the desired index scan consistency for current N1QL query.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Search.SearchScanConsistency.NotBounded
member.summary: The default which means that the query can return data that is currently indexed and accessible by the index or the view. The query output can be arbitrarily out-of-date if there are many pending mutations that have not been indexed by the index or the view. This consistency level is useful for queries that favor low latency and do not need precise and most up-to-date information.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Search.SearchScanConsistency.RequestPlus
member.summary: This level provides the strictest consistency level and thus executes with higher latencies than the other levels. This consistency level requires all mutations, up to the moment of the query request, to be processed before the query execution can start.

member.name: F:Couchbase.Search.SearchScanConsistency.AtPlus
member.summary: Do not use; for RYOW use and do not specify a .

member.name: T:Couchbase.TuningOptions
member.summary: Options for performance tuning specific to the .NET SDK.

member.name: P:Couchbase.TuningOptions.MaximumOperationBuilderCapacity
member.summary: Maximum size of a buffer used for building key/value operations to be sent to the server which will be retained for reuse. Buffers larger than this value will be disposed. If your application is consistently sending mutation operations larger than this value, increasing the value may improve performance at the cost of RAM utilization. Defaults to 1MB.

member.name: P:Couchbase.TuningOptions.MaximumRetainedOperationBuilders
member.summary: Maximum number of buffers used for building key/value operations to be sent to the server which will be retained for reuse. If your application has a very high degree of parallelism (for example, a very large number of data nodes), increasing this number may improve performance at the cost of RAM utilization. Defaults to the 4 times the number of logical CPUs.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Utils.LightweightStopwatch
member.summary: A lightweight stopwatch implementation.
member.remarks: This implementation doesn't support stopping, and has a poor resolution compared to (approximately 10-16 milliseconds). However, on .NET Core 3.1 and later it avoids heap allocations in cases where higher resolution is not required. For older frameworks we fallback to a since Environment.TickCount64 is not available and has issues wrapping to negative numbers.

member.summary: Rents a block of memory of a specific length.
member.typeparam: The type of the objects that are in the memory.
member.returns: The block of memory. The caller is responsible for releasing this memory when it is no longer in use.
member.remarks: The normal implementation of may return more memory than requested. This method will reduce the size of the returned memory if more is returned than requested. Note that a greater amount of memory may still be reserved, it is just unused.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Utils.SlicedMemoryOwner`1
member.summary: Wraps a with information to access a subset of the memory. This is particularly useful when renting memory from a , which may return a larger array of memory than desired.
member.typeparam: The type of the objects that are in the memory.
member.remarks:
Disposing of this object is simply a forwarder to dispose of the owned memory. It assumed that this type follows the same rules for memory ownership as . For example, calls which return this type assume that the caller takes ownership of the returned value. Calls which accept this type as a parameter assume that the callee takes ownership of the passed value.
Failing to dispose of this type may result in memory leaks. Using this object after it is disposed may result in accessing memory in use for other purposes.
While this structure does implement , casting to the interface should be avoided as it will cause boxing.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Utils.SynchronizationContextExclusion
member.summary: Temporarily removes the from the current thread, replacing it once the object is disposed.
member.remarks: This is designed to help prevent deadlocks when synchronously waiting on an asynchronous task, as in http://blogs.msdn.com/b/pfxteam/archive/2012/04/13/10293638.aspx. This class is designed to be used with a "using" clause for simplicity and to guarantee that the context is replaced even if there is an exception.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Utils.TimerFactory.CreateWithFlowSuppressed(System.Threading.TimerCallback,System.Object,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a where the does not flow to the callbacks.
member.param: A delegate representing a method to be executed.
An object containing information to be used by the callback method, or null.
The amount of time to delay before the is invoked. Specify to prevent the timer from starting. Specify to start the timer immediately.
The time interval between invocations of . Specify to disable periodic signaling.
member.exception: The number of milliseconds in the value of or is negative and not equal to .
member.remarks: This is important for long-running timers (i.e. which repeat based on ) to avoid the appearance of memory leaks. Much of the Couchbase SDK is lazy initialized, meaning it doesn't start up until the first time it is used in a request. This means that values which are part of the ExecutionContext at bootstrap may continue to live indefinitely. This may include activity tracing, the first HttpContext, etc, and may cause memory leaks or other undesired behaviors.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Utils.TimeSpanExtensions.ToMicroseconds(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Converts a to an in Microseconds.
member.remarks: This will overflow at 1hour 11min 34s, which shouldn't be encountered in most cases, but could throw an exception in edge cases like wrapping a span around a background operation or leaving the code on a breakpoint and going to lunch.
member.param: The duration to convert to microseconds.
member.returns: The microsecond equivalent of the passed in duration.

member.summary: Converts a into an uint correctly representing a Time-To-Live, that is expressed in seconds. Durations strictly bigger than 30 days are converted to a unix-syle timestamp (seconds since the Epoch), as described in the couchbase TTL documentation.
member.returns: The TTL, expressed as a suitable uint.

member.name: T:Couchbase.Views.StreamingViewResult`2
member.summary: Represents a streaming View response for reading each row as it becomes available over the network. Note that unless there is no underlying collection representing the response, instead the rows are extracted from the stream one at a time. If the Enumeration is evaluated, eg calling ToListAsync(), then the entire response will be read. Once a row has been read from the stream, it is not available to be read again. A will be thrown if the result is enumerated after it has reached the end of the stream.
member.typeparam: Type of the key for each result row.
Type of the value for each result row.
